entry.title: Missile Strike Kills Dozens Fleeing at Donbas Train Station
entry.content: A Russian attack on the Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk killed 50 and injured nearly 100 people as they tried to flee intense fighting in the east, Ukrainian authorities said.

entry.title: Shanghai's Omicron Outbreak Corners Chinese Leader
entry.content: Xi Jinping looked to ease China’s zero-Covid strategy until the highly contagious variant forced a return to strict lockdowns. He faces a dilemma other world leaders hope their countries never see again.

entry.title: Ukrainians Search for Relatives in Besieged Mariupol
entry.content: Some 160,000 people remain stranded in the city. One woman has spent weeks contacting acquaintances and strangers in an effort to locate family members there, as Moscow’s assault grinds on.

entry.title: Inflation Tightens Race Between France's Macron and Far Right Le Pen
entry.content: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen is closing in on President Emmanuel Macron as inflation hits voters’ pocketbooks ahead of elections Sunday.
